post_text: March 28, 2015 at 12:29 PM#1Hi all,This week I created 3 nice macro's to change the store option,(pf filter,embedded and store mode)The first 2 macro's works fine for me.But the third(mode selective,global,universal) are not working fine.my syntax is:  Assign Root 39.$USERPROFILE.15.3 /MODE=SELECTIVEWhen I look in the TUI (CD 39.userprofile.15) the syntax works.But when i return to the store option menu the mode is still the same.Can someone tell my why the TUI and the store option menu are not linked?Many thanks,Cedric

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: April 5, 2015 at 12:01 AM#2Be aware that within the userprofile there are two different places that holds configurations for storemode:List Userprofile 1.*#8: StoreDefaults (default settings)#15: StoreSettings (current temporary settings)If you want to change your default settings you should use item 8to temporary store with a specific mode, forcing the mode in the Storesyntax would probably be easier than changing item 15For both scenarios, If you are to make a macro, I would recommend to use names, as the index-numbering might change when you update to a new softwareversion:(remember to use quotes also for variables:Assign Root "Userprofiles".$"USERPROFILE"."StoreDefaults"."PresetDefaults" /MODE=SELECTIVE
